headline.print_headline: Sanders Walking the Line Between Personal Attacks and Political Critiques
headline.main: Bernie Sanders Walking the Line Between Personal Attacks and Political Critiques

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and MAGGIE HABERMAN

snippet: Senator Bernie Sanders has said he would not attack Hillary Rodham Clinton harshly. But pollsters for his campaign are quietly testing pointed critiques of his Democratic opponent.
abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders is seen as walking fine line in his presidential campaign between not attacking Hillary Rodham Clinton personally, but drawing sharp contrasts between their stances on issues; he seeks to lure more lower-income Democrats and liberal women from her base of support in early voting states.
lead_paragraph: Senator Bernie Sanders has said he would not attack Hillary Rodham Clinton harshly. But pollsters for his campaign are quietly testing pointed critiques of his Democratic opponent.
